t: For the director of music. To the tune of “A Dove on Distant Oaks.” Of David. A miktam. When the Philistines had seized him in Gath.
Be*pn merciful to me, my God, for*ld my enemies are in hot pursuit; all*ld day long they press their attack.
My*ln adversaries pursue me all day long; in*ld their pride many are attacking me.
When*pn I am afraid, I put my trust in you.
In*ld God, whose word I praise— in*ln God I trust and am not afraid. What*ld can mere mortals do to me?
All*pn day long they twist my words; all*ld their schemes are for my ruin.
They*ln conspire, they lurk, they*ld watch my steps, hoping*ld to take my life.
Because*ln of their wickedness do not let them escape; in*ld your anger, God, bring the nations down.
Record*pn my misery; list*ld my tears on your scroll— are*ld they not in your record?
Then*ln my enemies will turn back when*ld I call for help. By*ld this I will know that God is for me.
In*pn God, whose word I praise, in*ld the Lord,*s whose word I praise—
in*ln God I trust and am not afraid. What*ld can man do to me?
I*pn am under vows to you, my God; I*ld will present my thank offerings to you.
For*ln you have delivered me from death and*ld my feet from stumbling, that*ln I may walk before God in*ld the light of life.
